Package renderer

Class AbstRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderer.AbstRenderer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ogl3Renderer, OglRenderer
    public abstract class AbstRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for renderer. A renderer provides various drawing functions to render a scene. This includes drawing of geometric primitives (lines, polygons, meshes, etc.) as well as functions to manage the drawing area (clear the screen, show the back buffer, etc.) To prevent display flicker the renderer maintains a front buffer (the visible picture) and a back buffer, where drawing operations take place. The back buffer will be made visible by a function call not until all drawing operations are finished. The renderer maintains the different states of the render engine in the form of a stack. Classes derived from AbstRenderer must call the methods of this class in their set*State-methods. A renderer can attach user data to scenegraph objects, to cache information needed by the render engine (e.g. texture or other ids needed when the underlying hardware is accessed). These objects should be referenced and kept in internal data structures, to make sure that this information is not lost when the object is removed from the scenegraph and thus not available to release hardware resources.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ursula Derichs

      • displayBackBuffer

        public abstract void displayBackBuffer()
        Shows the back buffer. This will end all drawing operations until the next call to beginDraw. The content of the back buffer is undefined after a call to this function.

      • attach

        public void attach​(AbstLight light)
        Attaches a light source to the scene. The given light source object is added to the current LightState.
        Parameters:
        light - light source object to attach

      • setLightingEnabled

        public abstract void setLightingEnabled​(boolean bEnabled)
        Turns lighting on or off. Lighting is enabled per default. This setting will be affected, when light sources are attached.
        Parameters:
        bEnabled - true, if lighting shall take place

      • multTransform

        public void multTransform​(Mat4 trans)
        Multiplies the current Transformation matrix with the given one. The given matrix is right multiplied.
        Parameters:
        trans - matrix to multiply with
